Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as bdfc5ec6932c9ecfe60dc4dfc08c8592b64a0d72

could probably just use length, field, start, size and end etc.
When reading the code in the function, it is hard to read with fruArea duplicated many times in one line of the code.
Why a global object? Is it replacing a bunch of global variable?
Done. Updated as a local object.
nit: add a user-friendly error message for better understandability. Eg: Invalid PropertyName.
please follow naming convention length, fieldLoc, etc
range checking before used in line874
please add description for these fields. It is not obvious what the difference between length and size is. Same thing for fieldLoc and fruDataIter.
Please add brief description of the functionality and input and output parameter

After reading this function and original code couple times, I realize that this function does not actually update the FRUArea. Instead, it iterate through the area and field to find the location and size of property field.
Please add description of the function in the header and rename the function to describe the code better.
Thanks for adding the comments. Only couple suggestions on the comments, otherwise it looks good to me.
fru field is found, fruAreaParams are updated with fruArea and field info

start and size of the fru area that contains the propertyName and the field start location for the property.
(Specify the four values gets updated/returned if successful).

Updated the comments given in the below patch.  This is the parent patch of below patch. I will update that patch as well.

https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/57110
Please be consistent in naming.  We have fru and Fru in this section
What about the case where data is stored in the multi-record area of the FRU?  On YV3.5, FRU data is planned to be stored in the MRA.

fruAreaInternal
 fruAreaChassis,
 fruAreaBoard,
 fruAreaProduct,
 fruAreaMultirecord

We have a support for the above fruAreas. 

But in this case, Chassis, Board and Product only handled. If needed, can add multi-record area case and define the appropriate offsets.
The multi-record area is used to store the type of BIC installed on the server.  We need to have this section implemented for YV3.5.

As per the IPMI spec for fru (Table 16-2), Multi record area has many Record Types. It has vast Record types. We may need to implement for each fields and properties mentioned for each Record types. 

So, Could you please confirm which Record Type we are following in the multi Record area to store the type of BIC installed on the server ? So that, we can have implementation for that particular Record type alone. Because, it has vast Record types. 

https://www.intel.com/content/dam/www/public/us/en/documents/product-briefs/platform-management-fru-document-rev-1-2-feb-2013.pdf

The following link shows the MRA data as requested.

https://github.com/facebookexternal/openbmc.wiwynn/blob/common_multi_source_fru_spec/common/recipes-utils/multi-source-fru/multi-source-fru.md

The above file link is not opened for me. I think, this is due to some permission issue.

But, the below link has same file name and directory structure. This link is accessible. 

https://github.com/facebook/openbmc/blob/helium/common/recipes-utils/multi-source-fru/multi-source-fru.md

This link has OEM multi record area FRU format. It has BIC and CPLD record info.

Could you please confirm once, the file link you mentioned above is same as this link ?
Yes, this is the same doc.  Please use it to implement the MRA support we need for YV3.5.
One other area to implement to align with expected use case for YV3.5 system where multi-record area is used for some multi-host FRU data.
